newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: RUGBY UNION-WESTERN SAMOA RUN IN FIVE TRIES.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-WESTERN SAMOA RUN IN FIVE TRIES.

text.p: Western Samoa ran in five tries on their way to a 40-25 victory over Ireland at Lansdowne Road on Tuesday.

They got off to a brilliant start when winger Afato So'oalo ran 65 metres to record an unconverted try in the second minute after scrumhalf Joe Filemu and centre To'o Vaega had combined to send him clear down the right wing.
Further tries from centre George Leaupepe and Vaega, added to 10 kicked points from fly-half Earl Va'a, had the visitors 25-12 ahead at the interval.
All of Ireland's first half scores came from the boot of full-back Simon Mason.
Tries for full-back Veli Patu and Vaega, his second, added to five more kicked points by Va'a, completed the Western Samoan scoring after the break.
Ireland had pulled back to 33-25 down in the 71st minute when prop forward Paul Wallace scoreda try, converted by Mason, under the posts.
But the home side could not break through a strong Western Samoan defence for a second try and had to rely on Mason to kick their remaining points.

Ireland: 15-Simon Mason; 14-Richard Wallace, 13-Robert Henderson, 12-Jonathan Bell, 11-James Topping; 10-David Humphreys, 9-Niall Hogan; 8-Paddy Johns, 7-Denis McBride (19-Victor Costello, 71), 6-David Corkery, 5-Jeremey Davidson, 4-Michael Galwey, 3-Paul Wallace, 2-Allen Clarke, 1-Henry Hurley.

Western Samoa: 15-Veli Patu; 14-Afato So'oalo, 13-To'o Vaega, 12-George Leaupepe, 11-Va'aiga Tuigamala; 10-Earl Va'a, 9-Joe Filemu; 8-Issac Feaunati, 7-Pat Lam , 6-Sene Ta'Ala, 5-Mark Birtwistle, 4-Potu Leavasa (19-Junior Paramore, 58), 3-Afa Le'uu, 2-Tala Leiasamaivao, 1-Billy Reidy.
